title: U.S. Deports Planeload of Iranians After Deal With Tehran, Officials Say
summary: The deportation flight to Iran is the most stark push yet by the Trump administration to deport migrants even to places with harsh human rights conditions.

title: Government Shutdown Appears Imminent After Trump Meets With Democrats
summary: President Trump met with Republican and Democratic leaders at the White House, but they emerged without a deal, as Democrats seek more health care funding.

title: Explaining the G.O.P.’s Misleading Talking Point on the Looming Shutdown
summary: Republicans have been falsely asserting that Democrats are shutting down the government to fund free health care for unauthorized immigrants.

title: Trump and Netanyahu Tell Hamas to Accept Gaza Cease-Fire Plan, Or Else
summary: President Trump said Israel would have a green light to “finish the job” if Hamas refused to agree to the cease-fire deal.

title: Read Each Point of Trump’s Plan for an Israel-Gaza Cease-Fire
summary: “If both sides agree to this proposal, the war will immediately end,” the White House proposal says.

title: U.S. Sues Pro-Palestinian Demonstrators Who Protested Outside Synagogue
summary: The Justice Department sued participants in a confrontation at a New Jersey synagogue that devolved into violence. An official said there might be more such cases to come.

title: Michigan Church Attacker Is Said to Have Held a Grudge Against Mormons
summary: Several friends and acquaintances of the man accused of attacking a Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints meetinghouse said he had long railed against the faith.

title: A 102-Year-Old Yoga Teacher’s Simple Approach to Aging Well
summary: For decades, Charlotte Chopin has been bending and stretching in Léré, a village in France. Here’s how she keeps moving.

title: Trump and Comey: An Escalating Conflict With No Off-Ramp
summary: The yearslong face-off between Donald Trump and James Comey amounts to a case study of how the president grew evermore emboldened to carry out his revenge agenda.

title: YouTube Settles Trump Lawsuit Over Account Suspension for $24.5 Million
summary: Mr. Trump had sued Alphabet, the parent of YouTube and Google, and other social media companies after the platforms suspended his accounts following the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the Capitol.

title: Health Department Moves to Block Harvard From Future Research Grants
summary: The White House and Harvard University have struggled to negotiate an end to their monthslong dispute over the administration’s campaign to expunge “woke” ideology from campuses.

title: N.Y.C. Mayoral Candidates Move to Capitalize on Adams’s Departure
summary: Zohran Mamdani and Curtis Sliwa hit the campaign trail on Monday after Eric Adams left the race, while Andrew Cuomo called donors.

title: What Eric Adams Has Said as an Outspoken Mayor of New York City
summary: At an afternoon news conference or a late-night talk show, it has been almost impossible to predict what New York City’s mayor might say next.

title: Trump Officials Flesh Out Tariffs on Kitchen Cabinets, Furniture and Timber
summary: The White House set a relatively low tariff on imports of timber and lumber, and a significantly higher tariff on furniture and kitchen cabinets.

title: Hegseth and Trump to Meet With Military Brass: What We Know
summary: Tuesday’s meeting at a Marine Corps base appears to be without precedent, and a lack of explanation for it has led to speculation and fear.

title: Lally Weymouth, Globe-Trotting Reporter and Scion of Graham Family, Dies at 82
summary: The daughter of Washington Post publisher Katharine Graham, she secured hard-to-land interviews with foreign leaders but found few opportunities for a leadership role.

title: Charlie Javice Sentenced to 85 Months in Prison for Fraud
summary: A federal jury in March had found Ms. Javice guilty for faking customer lists during JPMorgan Chase’s $175 million acquisition of her start-up.

title: What It Takes to Get Lunch Delivered to the 70th Floor
summary: An informal network of last-mile runners close the gap between harried delivery drivers and hungry office workers in a Shenzhen skyscraper.

title: Death of Trey Reed, a Black Man, in Mississippi Strikes Nerves in the U.S.
summary: The authorities say Trey Reed took his own life on his college campus, but in a nation ready to jump to judgment and in a state with its history of racial violence, that conclusion has not ended the story.

title: College Students Are Seeking Out Phone-Free Social Connection
summary: A campus movement aims to find out.

title: Can the Trump Peace Plan Overcome Unprecedented Cruelty?
summary: Donald Trump’s peace plan will be like solving a diplomatic Rubik’s cube every day — while all the enemies of the deal try to scramble it.

title: Democrats Are in Crisis. Eat-the-Rich Populism Is the Only Answer.
summary: A blistering assault on economic elites, a moderate stance on cultural issues and a rejection of politics as usual. That’s how to remake the Democratic Party.

title: Peace Broker, Arms Supplier: China’s Dual Roles in a Deadly Conflict
summary: China urged Cambodia and Thailand to end their border war in July. But weeks earlier, it had sent rockets and artillery shells to Cambodia, Thai intelligence documents show.

title: Mika Immonen, Champion Pool Player Known as the Iceman, Dies at 52
summary: He won the world nine-ball title in 2001 and the 10-ball title in 2009, as well as back-to-back U.S. Opens, earning his nickname for his steely demeanor.

title: ‘Kpop Demon Hunters’ Noodle Cup Trend May Increase Burn Risks for Kids
summary: TikTok users have rushed to get their hands on the instant noodles that appear in the film. One prominent Boston hospital has sounded the alarm.
